article.simpara: This is a documentation of a series of sub-divisions of the Co-Dfns compiler development into a series of increments for implementing specific elements over time. Each of these series is design to be very very short due to the short iteration cycle that we have, hopefully to be tested rapidly and easily.
article.para: Note that the summary column of the following table only gives a summary of the features, with the intent of giving an intuition to readers of this document who do not understand the canonical sequences or state spaces used to define features of the compiler. It is highly recommended that readers do not rely on the summary information to inform their expectations of compiler features. Instead, a quick reading of the Function Specification front matters, especially the Stimuli and Responses section, together with an examination of the Canonical Sequence Analysis section will give the reader all the necessary information to understand the more precise and accurate functionality descriptions.
